Properties.ProtectedString:
Tool = script.Parent
local stillEquipped = false
function onEquippedLocal(mouse) stillEquipped = true if mouse == nil then print("Mouse not found") return end while stillEquipped do print("Setting Mouse to go") mouse.Icon = "rbxasset://textures\\GunCursor.png" while Tool.Enabled and stillEquipped do wait(0.01) end print("Setting Mouse to wait") mouse.Icon = "rbxasset://textures\\GunWaitCursor.png" while not Tool.Enabled and stillEquipped do wait(0.01) end end end
function onUnequippedLocal() stillEquipped = false end
Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquippedLocal) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequippedLocal)

-- Paper sword script, based on existing sword scripts (EelSword and MahjongSword, since they're what I have).
-- No stab attack; that's probably too violent for Town and City. Touch damage is 0, and slash damage, -- while there, is VERY minimal. -- Also, you can unfold (or refold) it with the 'x' key. local TOUCH_DAMAGE = 0 local SLASH_DAMAGE = 0.3 local damage = TOUCH_DAMAGE -- The current damage, set to one of the above.
local Tool = script.Parent local Sword = Tool.Handle local CloneTool = Tool:Clone()
local Paper local PaperWeld
local slashAnim local slashSound local unfoldAnim local foldAnim local foldSound local alreadyUnfolded = false
local myCharacter local myHumanoid local myPlayer local Torso local RightArm local LeftArm
local signs = {57197301, 57197341, 57197361} local signMesh
local INITIAL_MESH_SIZE = Vector3.new(2, 2, 2) local INITIAL_GRIP_POS = Vector3.new(0, 0, -1.75)
-- Tentative lock Tool.Enabled = true
function tagHumanoid(humanoid, player) if humanoid and player then local creatorTag = Instance.new("ObjectValue") creatorTag.Name = "creator" creatorTag.Parent = humanoid creatorTag.Value = player end end
function untagHumanoid(humanoid) if humanoid then local tag = humanoid:FindFirstChild("creator") if tag then tag:Remove() end end end
function blow(hit) if not hit or not hit.Parent then return end -- Set up local variables for the attacking and hit players myCharacter = Tool.Parent myHumanoid = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") myPlayer = game.Players:GetPlayerFromCharacter(myCharacter) local hitHumanoid = hit.Parent:FindFirstChild("Humanoid")
-- Check to make sure the hit was on someone else. if not myHumanoid or not hitHumanoid or myHumanoid == hitHumanoid then return end -- And that the attacker still has a right arm. RightArm = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Right Arm") if not RightArm then return end -- And that he's still holding the sword... local RightGrip = RightArm:FindFirstChild("RightGrip")
if RightGrip and (RightGrip.Part0 == Sword or RightGrip.Part1 == Sword) then -- Now we're good to proceed, so: do damage and make (and remove) the leaderboard tag. hitHumanoid:TakeDamage(damage) tagHumanoid(hitHumanoid, myPlayer) wait(1) untagHumanoid(hitHumanoid) end end
--displayAndWeldPaper: creates the paper object in front of the player function displayAndWeldPaper() -- Make a new part for the paper... Paper = Instance.new("Part") Paper.Name = "Paper" Paper.FormFactor = 3 Paper.Size = Vector3.new(1, .2, 1) Paper.CanCollide = false Paper.Locked = true Paper.BrickColor = BrickColor.new(5) Paper.Parent = game.Workspace Paper.CFrame = Torso.CFrame + 2 * Torso.CFrame.lookVector
signMesh = Instance.new("SpecialMesh") signMesh.MeshId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=57196972" math.random(tick()) signMesh.TextureId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id="..signs[math.random(1, 3)] signMesh.Scale = Vector3.new(0.25, 0.25, 0.25) signMesh.Parent = Paper
-- And weld it to the character('s torso). PaperWeld = Instance.new("Weld") PaperWeld.Parent = Paper PaperWeld.Part0 = Paper PaperWeld.Part1 = Torso PaperWeld.C0 = CFrame.new(Vector3.new(0, -0.2, 1.5)) -- N.B. Weld coordinates are apparently measured in the coordinate systems of their component objects! -- So using Torso.CFrame.lookVector didn't work here.
-- Make a mesh for the paper, so that it actually looks like paper. -- local PaperMesh = Instance.new("SpecialMesh") -- PaperMesh.Name = "Paper Mesh" --PaperMesh.MeshId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=54002410" -- But for now, it looks --PaperMesh.TextureId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=53969202" -- like a Sword Fish. --PaperMesh.Scale = Vector3.new(0, 0, 0) --PaperMesh.Parent = Paper end
-- unfold: turns the sword into a sign with a childlike message on it, supposed to be a piece of paper -- that is the sword unfolded. Even though the sword is actually made of cardboard :P This function also -- accomplishes the reverse process, by calling fold() if the sword is already unfolded. function unfold(key) if key:lower() ~= "x" then return end if not Tool.Enabled then return end Tool.Enabled = false
myCharacter = Tool.Parent if not myCharacter then return end myHumanoid = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") if not myHumanoid then return end RightArm = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Right Arm") LeftArm = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Left Arm") Torso = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Torso") unfoldAnim = myHumanoid:LoadAnimation(Tool.SwordToPaper) if unfoldAnim then unfoldAnim:Play() end
if alreadyUnfolded then fold() return end
alreadyUnfolded = true
foldSound = Tool:FindFirstChild("FoldSound") if foldSound then foldSound:Play() end wait(0.5) -- sword should now be held directly in front of character.
displayAndWeldPaper()
if not RightArm or not LeftArm then return end for i = 1, 25 do Sword.Mesh.Scale = (25.0 - i) / 25.0 * INITIAL_MESH_SIZE Tool.GripPos = INITIAL_GRIP_POS + Vector3.new(0, 0, i/12.5) --PaperMesh.Scale = Vector3.new(i/25.0, i/25.0, i/25.0) wait(.02) end
-- And reset the tool.
Tool.Enabled = true
end
--fold: refolds paper into a sword after the sword has already been unfolded. function fold() -- We're already guaranteed that tool was enabled (but has been set to disabled). -- We're also guaranteed that the player still exists, and that we've tried to access -- his arms. if not RightArm or not LeftArm then return end
alreadyUnfolded = false foldAnim = myHumanoid:LoadAnimation(Tool.PaperToSword) if foldAnim then foldAnim:Play() end
wait(0.5) -- For the animation. foldSound = Tool:FindFirstChild("FoldSound") if foldSound then foldSound:Play() end
for i = 1, 25 do Sword.Mesh.Scale = i / 25.0 * INITIAL_MESH_SIZE Tool.GripPos = INITIAL_GRIP_POS + Vector3.new(0, 0, (25.0 - i)/12.5) signMesh.Scale = Vector3.new((25.0 - i)/100.0, (25.0 - i)/100.0, (25.0 - i)/100.0) wait(.02) end if Paper then Paper:Remove() end
-- Wait for animation to finish wait(0.5)
-- Reset the tool
Tool.Enabled = true end
function onActivated() -- First make sure we're trying to swing a sword, not a piece of paper. if alreadyUnfolded then return end
-- Make some checks: user is still alive, tool is enabled, etc. if not Tool.Enabled then return end Tool.Enabled = false -- And make sure the tool isn't enabled for the next few seconds! myCharacter = Tool.Parent if not myCharacter then return end myHumanoid = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") if not myHumanoid then return end
-- If we're good to go forward, then just slash! damage = SLASH_DAMAGE slashAnim = myHumanoid:LoadAnimation(Tool.Slash) if slashAnim then slashAnim:Play() end slashSound = Tool:FindFirstChild("CrumpleSound") if slashSound then slashSound:Play() end
-- Wait for animation and sound to finish, then reset everything we just changed. wait(1) damage = TOUCH_DAMAGE Tool.Enabled = true
end
function onEquipped(mouse) --No unsheath sound; it's a paper sword, for Pete's sake! mouse.KeyDown:connect(unfold)
-- Get rid of Paper... if Paper then Paper:Remove() end if alreadyUnfolded then -- Replace it, and resize the sword, if necessary... displayAndWeldPaper() Sword.Mesh.Scale = Vector3.new(0, 0, 0) Tool.GripPos = INITIAL_GRIP_POS + Vector3.new(0, 0, 2) else -- or just resize the sword. Sword.Mesh.Scale = INITIAL_MESH_SIZE Tool.GripPos = INITIAL_GRIP_POS end
end
function onUnequipped() -- Stop sounds and/or animations if slashAnim then slashAnim:Stop() end if slashSound then slashSound:Stop() end if foldAnim then foldAnim:Stop() end if unfoldAnim then unfoldAnim:Stop() end if foldSound then foldSound:Stop() end
-- Get rid of Paper and, if necessary, reset the size. if Paper then Paper:Remove() end if alreadyUnfolded then Sword.Mesh.Scale = INITIAL_MESH_SIZE Tool.GripPos = INITIAL_GRIP_POS end
end
Tool.Activated:connect(onActivated) Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquipped) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequipped)
Sword.Touched:connect(blow)
